remarks: This lemma is used to prove that ` x ` built as in Lemma 2 of [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 91, is such that x < ε on ` A ` .  Here ` X ` is used to represent ` x ` in the paper, ` E ` is used to represent ε in the paper, and ` D ` is used to represent ` A ` in the paper (because ` A ` is always used to represent the subalgebra).  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
stoweidlem48.1 $e |- F/ i ph $.
stoweidlem48.2 $e |- F/ t ph $.
stoweidlem48.3 $e |- Y = { h e. A | A. t e. T ( 0 <_ ( h ` t ) /\ ( h ` t ) <_ 1 ) } $.
stoweidlem48.4 $e |- P = ( f e. Y , g e. Y |-> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) x. ( g ` t ) ) ) ) $.
stoweidlem48.5 $e |- X = ( seq 1 ( P , U ) ` M ) $.
stoweidlem48.6 $e |- F = ( t e. T |-> ( i e. ( 1 ... M ) |-> ( ( U ` i ) ` t ) ) ) $.
stoweidlem48.7 $e |- Z = ( t e. T |-> ( seq 1 ( x. , ( F ` t ) ) ` M ) ) $.
stoweidlem48.8 $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN ) $.
stoweidlem48.9 $e |- ( ph -> W : ( 1 ... M ) --> V ) $.
stoweidlem48.10 $e |- ( ph -> U : ( 1 ... M ) --> Y ) $.
stoweidlem48.11 $e |- ( ph -> D C_ U. ran W ) $.
stoweidlem48.12 $e |- ( ph -> D C_ T ) $.
stoweidlem48.13 $e |- ( ( ph /\ i e. ( 1 ... M ) ) -> A. t e. ( W ` i ) ( ( U ` i ) ` t ) < E ) $.
stoweidlem48.14 $e |- ( ph -> T e. _V ) $.
stoweidlem48.15 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A ) -> f : T --> RR ) $.
stoweidlem48.16 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A /\ g e. A ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) x. ( g ` t ) ) ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem48.17 $e |- ( ph -> E e. RR+ ) $.
stoweidlem48 $p |- ( ph -> A. t e. D ( X ` t ) < E ) $.
